UltraMotionCapture.kps.Kps#

class UltraMotionCapture.kps.Kps[source]#

Bases: object

A collection of the key points that can be attached to a 3D object, i.e. a frame of the 4D object.

Note

Class Attributes

self.points

\(N\) key points in 3D space stored in a dictionary.

self.scale_rate

the scaling rate of the Vicon key points.

Example

After initialisation, the Kps object is empty. Load key points from Vicon motion capture data stored in a MarkerSet object with load_from_markerset_frame() or load_from_markerset_time().

from UltraMotionCapture import kps

vicon = kps.MarkerSet()
vicon.load_from_vicon('data/6kmh_softbra_8markers_1.csv')
vicon.interp_field()

points = kps.Kps()
points.load_from_markerset_time(vicon, time = 1.01)

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

add_point(name: str, coord: numpy.array)[source]#

Add a point to self.points with its name and its coordinates represented in a (3, ) numpy.array.

Parameters

  • name – the name of the added point.

  • point – (3, ) numpy.array.

get_points_coord(names: Union[None, list, tuple] = None) → numpy.array[source]#

Concatenating all coordinates into a (N, 3) numpy.array and return.

Parameters

names – the names of the points to be retrieved. If doesn’t input this parameter, all points will be returned.

Returns

coordinates stored in a (N, 3) numpy.array in the order of the names.

Return type

numpy.array

static diff(kps1: Type[UltraMotionCapture.kps.Kps], kps2: Type[UltraMotionCapture.kps.Kps]) → dict[source]#

Compute the difference of one key points object with another.

Warning

These two key points objects must contain the same number of points with the same names.

Parameters

  • kps1 – a key points object.

  • kps2 – another key points object.

Returns

A dictionary that contains the comparison result:

  • 'disp': the displacement vectors from the predicted key points to the ground truth key points stored in a (N, 3) numpy.array.

  • 'dist': the distances from the first key points to the second key points stored in a (N, ) numpy.array.

  • 'dist_mean': the mean distances from the first key points to the second key points.

  • 'dist_std': the standard deviation of distances.

  • 'diff_str': a string in form of 'dist_mean ± dist_std (mm).

Return type

dict

show()[source]#

Illustrate the key points object.

add_to_scene(scene: pyvista.plotting.plotting.Plotter, location: numpy.array = array([0, 0, 0]), radius: float = 1, **kwargs) → pyvista.plotting.plotting.Plotter[source]#

Add the visualisation of current object to a pyvista.Plotter scene.

Parameters

  • scene – pyvista.Plotter scene to add the visualisation.

  • location – the displace location represented in a (3, ) numpy.array.

  • radius – radius of the key points

  • **kwargs –

    other visualisation parameters.

    See also
